sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"大的"之意。
means: big ： 常用词，使用广泛，较口语化。多指体积、重量或容量等方面的"大"，有时也用于描写抽象之物。
large ： 普通用词，含义广，指体积、面积、容量、数量以及程度等方面的大，具体或抽象意义均可用。
great ： 普通用词，可指具体东西的"大"，但更常指事物的重要，人的行为、品格的伟大等，带一定的感情色彩。
grand ： 侧重指盛大、绝大，有气派。

sentence.Network_en: The wind was bouncing the branches of the big oak trees.
sentence.Network_cn: 一棵棵高大橡树的枝条随风摇摆。

sentence.Network_en: Big credits were given to East Germany by successive West German governments.
sentence.Network_cn: 历届西德政府给予东德大量的贷款。

sentence.Network_en: Bake some big red peppers and hollow them out.
sentence.Network_cn: 将几个大红甜椒烤一烤，再把它们掏空。

means.word_mean: 大的,巨大的;重大的;伟大的

encyclopedia.content: 《BIG》为2012年韩国KBS电视台月火电视剧，由全基尚导演指导拍摄，是人气作家洪贞恩、洪美兰（洪氏姐妹）的最新作品。该剧由孔侑，李敏贞及miss A成员...

entry.def: A big person or thing is large in physical size.

example.tran: 澳大利亚是个幅员辽阔的国家。

example.ex: Her husband was a big man...

entry.def: Something that is big consists of many people or things.

example.ex: The crowd included a big contingent from Ipswich.
example.tran: 人群中有来自伊普斯威奇的一个人数众多的代表团。

entry.tran: 严重的；重大的；大幅度的
entry.def: If you describe something such as a problem, increase, or change as a big one, you mean it is great in degree, extent, or importance.

example.ex: Her problem was just too big for her to tackle on her own...
example.tran: 她的问题太严重了，光靠她自己是没法解决的。

example.ex: There could soon be a big increase in unemployment.
example.tran: 失业人数可能很快就会出现大幅增长。

entry.def: A big organization employs many people and has many customers.

example.ex: Exchange is largely controlled by big banks.
example.tran: 货币兑换业务主要由大银行控制。

example.ex: ...one of the biggest companies in Italy.
example.tran: 意大利最大的公司之一

entry.def: If you say that someone is big in a particular organization, activity, or place, you mean that they have a lot of influence or authority in it.

example.ex: Their father was very big in the army...
example.tran: 他们的父亲在军中很有影响力。

example.ex: I'm sure all the big names will come to the club.
example.tran: 我相信所有的大人物都会到这个俱乐部来。

entry.tran: （强调厌恶之深）十足的，突出的
entry.def: If you call someone a big bully or a big coward, you are emphasizing your disapproval of them.
Children often refer to their older brother or sister as their big brother or sister.
Capital letters are sometimes referred to as big letters.
Big words are long or rare words which have meanings that are difficult to understand.

example.ex: They use a lot of big words.
example.tran: 他们使用很多生僻的词汇。

entry.def: If you make it big, you become successful or famous.

example.ex: We're not just looking at making it big in the UK, we want to be big internationally.
example.tran: 我们不仅想在英国取得成功，还想在国际上扬名立万。

entry.def: If you think big, you make plans on a large scale, often using a lot of time, effort, or money.

example.ex: Maybe we're not thinking big enough.
example.tran: 也许我们的抱负还不够远大。

entry.def: If something is happening in a big way, it is happening on a large scale.

example.ex: I think boxing will take off in a big way here.
example.tran: 我想拳击运动在这儿会有很大的发展。

means.word_mean: 1. above average in size or number or quantity or magnitude or extent;

sentences.sentence: "graduation was a big day in his life"
"deciding to drop the atom bomb was a very big decision"
"a heart big enough to hold no grudges"
"that's very big of you to be so forgiving"

means.word_mean: 15. in an advanced stage of pregnancy;

sentences.sentence: "the play failed big at the box office"

slang.tokens: make little ones out of big ones

list.explanation: [黑社会用语]在狱中服刑(原指在狱中服劳役，将大石块砸成小石块)

example.en: He got made little ones out of big ones for two years.
He decided not to make advances to her for fear of big E.
example.zh: 他害怕遭到招绝，决定不向她求爱。

example.en: l knew they would bring in the big guns at the last minute.
example.zh: 我早就知道在最后时刻他们会把那些大人物搬出来的。

example.en: Against these big critics' big guns. I offer Serban & Co. some shelter.
example.zh: 我为塞班公司捉供挡箭牌来对付那些大批评家的抨击。

list.explanation: (指某事物)不难，不重要，没问题，不麻烦

example.en: Don't worry. It's no big deal.
What she did is no biggie.
example.zh: 她干的事没什么了不起的。

example.en: Getting a passport's no big deal.

list.explanation: 不受欢迎的建议或行动，馊主意

example.en: I'm really interested in her in a big way.
example.zh: 我的确对她非常感兴趣。

slang.tokens: talk on the big white phone

example.en: One more beer and I'm gonna have to go talk on the big white phone.
example.zh: 再多喝一杯啤酒，我就非要跑到洗手间去呕吐不可怜。

example.en: My big moment is not exactly a good looker, but he is pleasant enough.
example.zh: 我的心上人尽管其貌不扬，但是他相当讨人喜欢。

example.en: The big cheese is giving everyone a bonus al the end of the year.
example.zh: 年终时老板给大家分红。

example.en: Don't be a big cheese, man !

means.word_mean: 大的, 硕大的, 高大的

sentences.en: There is a big bell in the room.
It's the big moment in my life.
sentences.cn: 这是我一生中的重大时刻。

sentences.en: The young man had big ideas.

means.word_mean: 年龄较大的, 长大了的

sentences.en: Don't cry, you are a big boy now.
sentences.cn: 不要哭, 你已经是大孩子了。

means.word_mean: 成功的; 大受欢迎的

sentences.en: Coca-Cola is very big in the West.
sentences.cn: 可口可乐在西方很流行。

jushi.english: This is a piece of big news.
The big question is under discussion.
jushi.chinese: 那个重要的问题正在讨论之中。

jushi.english: There is a big bell in the room.
